result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rick A Laumann

defendant.name: Laumann, Rick A
defendant.address: N4207 County Road DJ, Juneau, WI 53039

records.addlTxt:
1:09 PM Defendant Rick A Laumann appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark David Lawton appeared by video for Rick A Laumann.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Lawton states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Lawton just received an offer from the DA's office.  Atty Lawton asks for another status due to his clients health issues.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on November 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rick A Laumann appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark David Lawton appeared by video for Rick A Laumann. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties. Atty Lawton waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant on his waiver.  BY THE COURT:  Bond to continue.  Set for status.
Status hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rick A Laumann not in court.  Attorney Mark David Lawton appeared by phone for Rick A Laumann. 
Atty Lawton did attempt to call the defendant but could not get ahold of him and does not know why he is not here today.  Atty Juech requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear and asks that the cash bond be forfieted.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue. 
Court will hold open the request for the bond to be forfieted

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol   *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

3:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rick A Laumann appeared by video, in custody. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. Court finds probable cause for the charge for Riverside purposes. 
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Burdon requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant asks for a signature bond

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions: 
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
Initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
